Package game.actions

Class TickableAction

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actions.Action
game.actions.TickableAction
Direct Known Subclasses:
FocusAction
public abstract class TickableAction
extends Action
A class that represents a tickable action.

    Constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void activate()
    Activates the TickableAction, making it active.
    void deactivate()
    Deactivates the TickableAction, making it inactive.
    java.lang.String execute​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
    Executes the TickableAction, but this abstract class does not provide a concrete implementation.

    Returns the default damage multiplier of the weapon.
    int getDefHitRate()
    Returns the default hit rate of the weapon.

    Checks if the TickableAction is currently active.
    java.lang.String menuDescription​(Actor actor)
    Provides a menu description for the TickableAction, but this abstract class does not provide a concrete implementation.
    abstract void reset()
    Resets the state of the TickableAction.
    void resetCounter()
    Resets the counter for the TickableAction to 0.
    void tick()
    Logic for the TickableAction to be executed every tick.

    • execute

      public java.lang.String execute​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
      Executes the TickableAction, but this abstract class does not provide a concrete implementation.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Action
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor performing the action
      map - the game map where the action is executed
      Returns:
      a description of the action's outcome (null in this abstract class)

    • menuDescription

      public java.lang.String menuDescription​(Actor actor)
      Provides a menu description for the TickableAction, but this abstract class does not provide a concrete implementation.
      Specified by:
      menuDescription in class Action
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor performing the action
      Returns:
      a description of the action for display in the game menu (null in this abstract class)

    • reset

      public abstract void reset()
      Resets the state of the TickableAction. Subclasses should implement this method to reset specific attributes.

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Activates the TickableAction, making it active.

    • deactivate

      public void deactivate()
      Deactivates the TickableAction, making it inactive.

    • isActive

      public java.lang.Boolean isActive()
      Checks if the TickableAction is currently active.
      Returns:
      true if the action is active, false otherwise

    • resetCounter

      public void resetCounter()
      Resets the counter for the TickableAction to 0.
